data.title: Go for the Amber....wait she is the bartender
data.text: Very cool place...enjoyed a flight...good beers...blackened drum was awesome....Amber was cool...very professional...spoke about the area and the brewery and restaurant....nice experience
Waiter was great! Food was sub-par. Such good reviews but a disappointment. Crawfish etoufe was bland and the flounder platter tasted like frozen fish.

data.title: My new favorite restaurant in Corpus
data.text: Everything was amazing - the seafood gumbo, the chicken fried steak, the peel and eat shrimp (so fresh) and the awesome broccoli coleslaw!!!  Want to go back to try their avocado salad but we are leaving tomorrow.  Such a great restaurant!!!!!!!

data.title: Over priced and bad food
data.text:
The jalapeño/cilantro ranch was very good 👍

However, We should have taken the hint when we walked in for dinner. I asked how long the wait was and she advised it was at least a 45 minute wait and the bar was 'full' so we couldn't wait there. It should be noted that there were no other parties waiting to be seated and the bar was empty. We waited at the bar. It took about 10 minutes to get the attention of a server to get drinks. 

There appeared to be friction with the employees as there were eye rolling and visible cues of frustration from the servers and those cleaning the floors and tables.  

We were seated in 15 minutes. It seemed as though they did not want to serve us. We are dinner on Saturday around 6:00. 

The wait to get our food was easily 45 minutes if not longer. My husband ordered blackened drum, it was burned to the point it wasn't edible and I had a grilled chicken salad. The chicken on my salad was cool to the touch (fully cooked it just sat for a while before we got it).  The meal was far from satisfying, the best part was the pizza my child ordered from the kids menu & even that wasn't impressive. 

We had several different beers as well. One of the 'house' beers tasted like acetone. 

We will not be returning and would not recommend this establishment.

data.title: Best Beer in the City and Burgers!
data.text: Railroad Brewing was my top choice of craft beers in the city. I visited 3 others Railroad was by far the best one! Had the honor of meeting Sean the Brewmaster! Keep up the good work Sean.

data.title: Worth your time
data.text: We called for a reservation following the THSWPA State Power Lifting Competition.  We arrived, and the servers asked us if we were sure of the name we gave and the time, as they couldn't find any information on our reservation. But we were seated quickly, nonetheless. The service was outstanding and the food was good. The prices were reasonable,  but seafood is expensive.

data.title: Not quite what I had hoped for
data.text: As a restaurant it is somewhat limited in its offerings as I had expected a bigger offering of seafood to choose from.  Decent offering of various beers though.  Also the wait staff was friendly and welcoming.  I suppose it is a good place if you are in a group.

data.title: beer, good service, enormous portions
data.text: my wife and i had a good meal, well served, with a tasty and interesting flight of beer and a glass of the house red.  we got a massive pile of onion rings, which was sweet and good.  we got  the red drum entree, very nice.  we got the avocado salad, also nice.  it was a nice night.  we didn't fall in love with the place, but we were not disappointed.

data.title: Yummy, good atmosphere
data.text: Shared a good meal with some girlfriends here. The grilled shrimp was delicious and the broccoli slaw was really good (balanced out the saltiness of the shrimp). Would love to come back here!

data.title: Fun place to eat and drink
data.text: Susan and I stopped here after a busy day of sigh-seeing, and were glad we did. We started with a beer sampler and judged them all good (Susan liked some better than I did and vice-versa). Susan had shrimp (for the third time in two days) and I had blackened catfish. All good, including the sides. Our server, Cruz, was friendly, efficient, and helpful. I highly recommend this new-ish place.

data.title: Wow! Nothing average here.
data.text: Read the 2 reviews and decided beer & seafood sounded good. Did a flight of their craft beers. EVERYONE of them was fantastic. Then the food came out. Fresh fish and Chicken Fried Steak were fabulous. Make your way here. Their special items (seafood sauce & brocolli slaw) are a real treat.

data.title: OK food; amazing pie
data.text: My brother-in-law assured me that he had been told there was a "secret" vegetarian menu so we stopped in for lunch. My BIL loves the brewing part of this restaurant and he and my husband eat fish. They loved their food. There was no "secret" menu so I had a grilled cheese sandwich, which is not on the menu so I guess it's a secret. Only other veggie options were fried cheese or leaving the beef off of an overpriced quesadilla. The sandwich was okay. The "hobo" fries (a combination of regular and sweet potatoes) were good. The key lime pie was pretty amazing. And for once the portion was actually large enough to share for a reasonable price ($5). The building is large and open so quite comfortable. Not too noisy. Serve was okay, not overly attentive but not ignoring us. I'd go again but probably skip the meal and head straight for dessert.

data.title: Stuffed
data.text: Wow, got the combo appetizer...didn't know it was huge....it was goooood. The catfish platter was also very good.
